header.title: Types of visas
header.subtitle: An overview of the main South African visa categories and what is typically required for each.

work.title: Work visas
work.body: Suitable for professionals, skilled workers and applicants with confirmed job offers or in-demand skills.
work.whoBody: Candidates with a job offer in South Africa, recognised qualifications or skills in demand according to local regulations.

requirementList.0: Valid job offer or employer sponsorship
requirementList.1: Proof of qualifications or professional registration (where applicable)
requirementList.2: Police clearance certificates and medical reports

study.title: Study visas
study.body: For school pupils, university students and those attending recognised training programmes.
study.whoBody: Anyone who has been accepted by a registered South African school, college, university or training institution.

requirementList.0: Letter of acceptance from an approved institution
requirementList.2: Valid medical cover and required health documentation

business.title: Business, investor & financial independence visas
business.body: Ideal for investors, entrepreneurs and individuals with significant financial resources who want to build a long-term presence in South Africa.
business.whoBody: Applicants planning to invest in, start or join a business in South Africa, or those who can demonstrate financial independence.

requirementList.0: Business or investment plan that meets local criteria
requirementList.1: Evidence of available capital or financial resources
requirementList.2: Compliance with sector-specific rules and regulations

family.title: Family, retirement & long-term visitor visas
family.body: For family reunification, retirement in South Africa or longer-term stays for non-working visitors.
family.whoBody: Spouses, partners, dependants, retirees and long-term visitors with a clear purpose for staying in South Africa.

requirementList.0: Proof of relationship, retirement funds or purpose of stay
requirementList.1: Medical reports and police clearances (where required)
requirementList.2: Financial evidence to support yourself during your stay
